arXiv:2310.06387v3 [cs.LG] 25 May 2024

Jailbreak and Guard Aligned Language Models
with Only Few In-Context Demonstrations
仅用少量情境示例破解和防护对齐语言模型

Zeming Wei1 Yifei Wang2 Ang Li1 Yichuan Mo1 Yisen Wang1
1Peking University 2MIT CSAIL Corresponding author (yisen.wang@pku.edu.cn).
Abstract  摘要

Large Language Models (LLMs) have shown remarkable success in various tasks, yet their safety and the risk of generating harmful content remain pressing concerns. In this paper, we delve into the potential of In-Context Learning (ICL) to modulate the alignment of LLMs. Specifically, we propose the In-Context Attack (ICA) which employs harmful demonstrations to subvert LLMs, and the In-Context Defense (ICD) which bolsters model resilience through examples that demonstrate refusal to produce harmful responses. We offer theoretical insights to elucidate how a limited set of in-context demonstrations can pivotally influence the safety alignment of LLMs. Through extensive experiments, we demonstrate the efficacy of ICA and ICD in respectively elevating and mitigating the success rates of jailbreaking prompts. Our findings illuminate the profound influence of ICL on LLM behavior, opening new avenues for improving the safety of LLMs.
大型语言模型（LLMs）在各种任务中表现出色，但它们的安全性和生成有害内容的风险仍然是紧迫的关切。在本文中，我们深入探讨了情境学习（ICL）在调节 LLMs 对齐方面的潜力。具体而言，我们提出了情境攻击（ICA），该攻击使用有害示例来破坏 LLMs，以及情境防御（ICD），该防御通过展示拒绝生成有害响应的示例来增强模型韧性。我们提供了理论见解，阐明有限数量的情境示例如何关键地影响 LLMs 的安全对齐。通过广泛的实验，我们分别展示了 ICA 和 ICD 在提升和降低破解提示成功率方面的有效性。我们的研究揭示了 ICL 对 LLM 行为的深远影响，为提高 LLMs 的安全性开辟了新的途径。

1 Introduction  1 引言

Large Language Models (LLMs) have achieved remarkable success across various tasks. However, their widespread use has raised serious safety concerns [3, 51, 10, 13], particularly regarding their potential for generating harmful content (e.g., toxic, unethical, or illegal content). To mitigate these concerns, extensive efforts have been made to align these language models and prevent harmful outputs during the training and fine-tuning phases [34, 5, 21, 56], as expected in the 1st example of Figure 1. Despite these efforts, recent works show that even aligned LLMs are still vulnerable to adversarial attacks, typically called the jailbreak issue of LLMs [46, 37, 15, 2]. By designing or optimizing adversarial prompts, attackers may successfully bypass the safeguard of LLMs as shown in the 2nd example of Figure 1.
大型语言模型（LLMs）在各项任务中取得了显著成功。然而，它们的广泛使用引发了严重的安全问题[3, 51, 10, 13]，特别是在它们生成有害内容（例如，有毒、不道德或非法内容）的潜力方面。为了缓解这些问题，人们付出了巨大努力来对齐这些语言模型，并在训练和微调阶段防止有害输出[34, 5, 21, 56]，正如图 1 的第一个示例所预期的那样。尽管付出了这些努力，但最近的研究表明，即使是对齐的 LLMs 仍然容易受到对抗性攻击，这通常被称为 LLMs 的越狱问题[46, 37, 15, 2]。通过设计或优化对抗性提示，攻击者可以成功绕过 LLMs 的安全机制，如图 1 的第二个示例所示。

Existing jailbreak attack techniques can be generally divided into optimization-based and template-based ones. Optimization-based attacks, iteratively refine a harmful prompt with query or gradient heuristics to elicit the LLMs to generate harmful content [61, 27, 9, 31], and Template-based attacks manually design persuasive instructions and attach them to the harmful prompt to achieve this goal [46, 24, 54]. However, optimization-based attacks often face the efficiency bottleneck, while template-based attacks usually derive fixed jailbreak prompts and lack scalability and flexibility. In this work, instead of directly designing persuasive instructions, we explore how in-context demonstrations can be utilized, where the demonstrations are flexible and can be easily scaled up. In-Context Learning (ICL) [6] is an intriguing property of LLMs that by prompting a few input-output pairs demonstrating a new task, LLMs can quickly adapt to the new task and give correct answers to new test examples without modifying any model parameters. Utilizing this property, we explore a new paradigm of adversarial attack on LLMs, called In-Context Attack (ICA) by incorporating harmful demonstrations that positively respond to toxic requests to the prompt, as illustrated in the 3rd example in Figure 1.
现有的越狱攻击技术通常可分为基于优化和基于模板两类。基于优化的攻击通过查询或梯度启发式迭代地优化有害提示，以诱使 LLMs 生成有害内容[61, 27, 9, 31]，而基于模板的攻击通过手动设计有说服力的指令并将其附加到有害提示上来实现这一目标[46, 24, 54]。然而，基于优化的攻击常面临效率瓶颈，而基于模板的攻击通常产生固定的越狱提示，缺乏可扩展性和灵活性。在本工作中，我们没有直接设计有说服力的指令，而是探索了如何利用情境演示，其中演示具有灵活性且易于扩展。情境学习（ICL）[6]是 LLMs 的一个引人入胜的特性，通过提示少量展示新任务的输入-输出对，LLMs 可以快速适应新任务，并针对新的测试示例给出正确答案，而无需修改任何模型参数。 利用这一特性，我们探索了一种针对 LLMs 的新型对抗攻击范式，称为情境攻击（ICA），通过结合对提示中的有害请求做出积极回应的有害示范来实现，如图 1 中的第 3 个示例所示。

On the other hand, preliminary defense techniques are also proposed against jailbreaking, like filtering [1, 7] and detection [36, 16] methods. Similar to the attack scenario, defensive templates like Self-reminder [49] are designed. In turn, we utilize a similar notion to defend LLMs with safe demonstrations, called In-Context Defense (ICD). In particular, we can teach the LLM to resist jailbreaking by adding a few examples of refusing harmful queries (4th example in Figure 1).
另一方面，针对越狱的初步防御技术也被提出，例如过滤[1, 7]和检测[36, 16]方法。类似于攻击场景，设计了防御模板，如 Self-reminder[49]。反过来，我们利用类似的概念通过安全示范来防御 LLMs，称为情境防御（ICD）。特别是，我们可以通过添加一些拒绝有害查询的示例来教会 LLM 抵抗越狱（图 1 中的第 4 个示例）。

Notably, unlike conventional demonstrations used in ICL for a particular task, our harmful and safe demonstrations (collectively called adversarial demonstrations) are crafted to manipulate the general safety of LLMs, which means the task of the demonstrations may be irrelevant to the query task, as exemplified in the 3rd and 4th examples in Figure 1. To understand the underlying mechanism of ICA and ICD, we build a theoretical framework to interpret the effectiveness of these adversarial demonstrations, where we illustrate how they can manipulate the safety of the LLM by inducing the generation distribution bias toward the target language distribution (harmful or safe).
值得注意的是，与我们用于特定任务的 ICL 中传统演示不同，我们的有害和安全的演示（统称为对抗性演示）旨在操纵 LLMs 的整体安全性，这意味着演示的任务可能与查询任务无关，如图 1 中的第 3 和第 4 个示例所示。为了理解 ICA 和 ICD 的潜在机制，我们构建了一个理论框架来解释这些对抗性演示的有效性，其中我们说明了它们如何通过诱导生成分布向目标语言分布（有害或安全）偏移来操纵 LLMs 的安全性。

We further provide comprehensive experiments to show the effectiveness and potential of ICA and ICD as red-teaming and guard techniques. For instance, ICA achieved 81% Attack Success Rate (ASR) on GPT-4 [33] evaluated by the AdvBench dataset [61], and ICD can reduce the ASR of Llama-2 [41] against transferable GCG from 21% to 0% while maintaining the natural performance of LLMs. These remarkable results demonstrate the power of in-context attack and defense, which suggests that aligned LLMs still have great flexibility to be revoked for certain beneficial or harmful behaviors using a few in-context demonstrations. Our contributions in this work can be summarized as follows:
我们进一步提供了全面的实验来展示 ICA 和 ICD 作为红队和防御技术的有效性和潜力。例如，ICA 在 GPT-4[33]上通过 AdvBench 数据集[61]评估达到了 81%的攻击成功率（ASR），而 ICD 可以将 Llama-2[41]在可迁移的 GCG 上的 ASR 从 21%降低到 0%，同时保持 LLMs 的自然性能。这些显著的结果展示了情境攻击和防御的力量，这表明对齐的 LLMs 仍然有很大的灵活性，可以通过少量的情境演示来撤销某些有益或有害的行为。这项工作中的贡献可以总结如下：

  1. 1.

    We explore the power of in-context demonstrations in manipulating the safety of LLMs and propose In-Context Attack (ICA) and Defense (ICD) for jailbreaking and guarding purposes.


    1. 我们探索了情境演示在操纵 LLMs 安全方面的力量，并提出了用于越狱和防御的情境攻击（ICA）和防御（ICD）。
  2. 2.

    We build a theoretical framework to offer insights into the effectiveness of a few adversarial demonstrations on manipulating the safety of LLMs.


    2. 我们构建了一个理论框架，以提供对少量对抗性演示在操纵 LLMs 安全方面的有效性的见解。
  3. 3.

    Through comprehensive experiments, we show the effectiveness of ICA and ICD in terms of attacking and defending LLMs, shedding light on the potential of adversarial demonstrations for advancing the safety and security of LLMs.


    3. 通过全面的实验，我们展示了 ICA 和 ICD 在攻击和防御 LLMs 方面的有效性，揭示了对抗性演示在提升 LLMs 安全性和安全性方面的潜力。

2 Related Work  2 相关工作

Jaibreak attack on aligned LLMs. Despite numerous efforts dedicated to aligning the value of LLMs with human and teaching them not to generate any harmful content [34, 5, 35, 17], recent studies show that LLMs are still vulnerable against carefully crafted jailbreak prompts [28, 39, 46] that can bypass their safeguard and trick them generate the requested harmful content. A line of research suggests optimizing jailbreak prompts through heuristics derived from gradients or queries. Gradient-heuristic attacks like GCG attack [40, 61] attach a suffix to the harmful request and then optimize it with gradient heuristics, but often require the white-box access to the victim model and also face the bottleneck of optimization efficiency [58, 26, 55]. Query-heuristic attacks derive jailbreak prompts by collecting responses from the model with existing prompts and then refining the jailbreak prompt with them. AutoDAN [27] and GA [23] utilize genetic algorithms to refine the prompt, while PAIR [9] and TAP [31] use another red-teaming LLM to achieve this.
对对齐 LLMs 的 Jailbreak 攻击。尽管投入了大量努力来使 LLMs 的价值与人类对齐，并教它们不要生成任何有害内容[34, 5, 35, 17]，但最近的研究表明，LLMs 仍然容易受到精心设计的 Jailbreak 提示[28, 39, 46]的攻击，这些提示可以绕过它们的保护机制，诱使它们生成所需的有害内容。一些研究通过从梯度或查询中推导出的启发式方法来优化 Jailbreak 提示。梯度启发式攻击，如 GCG 攻击[40, 61]，在有害请求后附加一个后缀，然后使用梯度启发式方法进行优化，但通常需要访问受害者模型的白盒，并且也面临优化效率的瓶颈[58, 26, 55]。查询启发式攻击通过收集现有提示下模型生成的响应来推导出 Jailbreak 提示，然后用这些响应来改进 Jailbreak 提示。AutoDAN[27]和 GA[23]利用遗传算法来改进提示，而 PAIR[9]和 TAP[31]则使用另一个红队 LLM 来实现这一点。

Another thread of attacks attempts to manually design jailbreaking templates that attach a stealthy instruction to the harmful prompt, like DAN (do anything now) [39], prefix injection (start with "sure, here’s") [46] and DeepInception [24] that construct a fictitious scene to modify the personification ability of LLMs. Several works also consider encoding the harmful conversation in a proper way to bypass the safeguard of LLMs, like Cipher [53], program code [38], ASCII art [20] and even low-resource languages [11, 52]. However, while these attacks bypass the need for model optimization and white-box access, the crafted templates tend to be rigid and lack scalability.
另一条攻击思路试图手动设计越狱模板，将隐蔽指令附加到有害提示中，例如 DAN（现在做任何事）[39]、前缀注入（以“好的，这是”开头）[46]和 DeepInception[24]，这些模板构建虚假场景以修改 LLMs 的人格化能力。一些研究还考虑以适当方式编码有害对话，以绕过 LLMs 的安全机制，例如 Cipher[53]、程序代码[38]、ASCII 艺术[20]甚至低资源语言[11, 52]。然而，虽然这些攻击绕过了模型优化和白盒访问的需求，但设计的模板往往比较僵化，缺乏可扩展性。

Defending LLMs against jailbreak attacks. In response to the jailbreaking attacks on LLMs, several preliminary defense techniques are designed. Notably, Although Adversarial Training (AT) [29] is generally considered one of the most effective approaches to defending against conventional adversarial attacks [8], the huge amount of parameters and data makes it somewhat impractical and ineffective to conduct AT on LLMs [16], thus current defense methods are typically designed during the generation stages of LLMs. Pre-processing methods detect or purify the potential harmful prompts, like perplexity filter [1], harmful string detection [22, 7], retokenization and paraphrasing [16] which are easy to plug-in to the model but may cause unaffordable false positives [42]. Similar to the template-based attacks, Self-reminders [49] propose to incorporate a safe instruction in the prompt to remind the model of being safe, yet also face the limitation of scalability and flexibility.
防御 LLMs 免受越狱攻击。针对对 LLMs 的越狱攻击，设计了几种初步防御技术。值得注意的是，尽管对抗训练（AT）[ 29] 通常被认为是防御传统对抗攻击 [ 8] 最有效的方法之一，但大量的参数和数据使得在 LLMs 上实施 AT [ 16] 在某种程度上不太实用且无效，因此目前的防御方法通常是在 LLMs 的生成阶段设计的。预处理方法检测或净化潜在的有害提示，如困惑度过滤器 [ 1]、有害字符串检测 [ 22, 7]、重新标记和释义 [ 16]，这些方法易于插入模型，但可能导致无法承受的误报 [ 42]。类似于基于模板的攻击，Self-reminders [ 49] 提出在提示中包含安全指令以提醒模型保持安全，但也面临可扩展性和灵活性的限制。

3 Proposed In-Context Attack and Defense
3 提出的上下文攻击和防御

In this section, we introduce our proposed In-context attack and defense methods. We start with briefly introducing the background of the in-context learning (ICL) paradigm, then propose and discuss the attack and defense methods respectively in the following.
在本节中，我们介绍了我们提出的情境攻击和防御方法。我们首先简要介绍了情境学习（ICL）的背景，然后在接下来的部分分别提出并讨论攻击和防御方法。

3.1 Background on In-Context Learning
3.1 情境学习背景

In-Context Learning (ICL) [6, 12] is an intriguing property that emerges in LLMs in which they learn a specific task demonstrated by a few input-label pair examples. Formally, given a demonstration set C={(x1,y1),⋯,(xk,yk)}𝐶subscript𝑥1subscript𝑦1⋯subscript𝑥𝑘subscript𝑦𝑘C=\{(x_{1},y_{1}),\cdots,(x_{k},y_{k})\}italic_C = { ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , ⋯ , ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) } where xisubscript𝑥𝑖x_{i}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT are query inputs and yisubscript𝑦𝑖y_{i}italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT are their corresponding labels in this task, a language model can learn a mapping f:𝒳→𝒴:𝑓→𝒳𝒴f:\mathcal{X}\to\mathcal{Y}italic_f : caligraphic_X → caligraphic_Y with f⁢(xi)=yi𝑓subscript𝑥𝑖subscript𝑦𝑖f(x_{i})=y_{i}italic_f ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and successfully predict the label ynewsubscript𝑦newy_{\text{new}}italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT new end_POSTSUBSCRIPT of a new input query 𝒙newsubscript𝒙new\boldsymbol{x}_{\text{new}}bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT new end_POSTSUBSCRIPT by prompting [x1,y1,⋯,xk,yk,𝒙new]subscript𝑥1subscript𝑦1⋯subscript𝑥𝑘subscript𝑦𝑘subscript𝒙new[x_{1},y_{1},\cdots,x_{k},y_{k},\boldsymbol{x_{\text{new}}}][ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋯ , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT new end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ].
情境学习（ICL）[6, 12] 是 LLMs 中一种引人入胜的特性，它们通过少数输入-标签对示例学习特定任务。形式上，给定一个演示集 C={(x1,y1),⋯,(xk,yk)}subscript1subscript1subscriptsubscriptC=\{(x_{1},y_{1}),\cdots,(x_{k},y_{k})\}italic_C = { ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , ⋯ , ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) } ，其中 xisubscriptx_{i}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT 是查询输入， yisubscripty_{i}italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT 是对应的任务标签，一个语言模型可以学习一个映射 f:𝒳→𝒴f:\mathcal{X}\to\mathcal{Y}italic_f : caligraphic_X → caligraphic_Y ，通过提示 [x1,y1,⋯,xk,yk,𝒙new]subscript1subscript1subscriptsubscriptsubscript[x_{1},y_{1},\cdots,x_{k},y_{k},\boldsymbol{x_{\text{new}}}][ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋯ , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT new end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] ，成功地预测新输入查询 𝒙newsubscript\boldsymbol{x}_{\text{new}}bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT new end_POSTSUBSCRIPT 的标签 ynewsubscripty_{\text{new}}italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT new end_POSTSUBSCRIPT 。

This mysterious property of LLMs has attracted much research attention on how to craft such in-context demonstrations for better learning performance [57, 44, 14, 45, 32, 50]. However, unlike these existing works mainly focus on leveraging ICL for improving the performance of a specific task (e.g., classification), our work focuses on characterizing the power of demonstrations in manipulating the safety level of LLMs across various types of tasks, which can be regarded as a more general ability. Specifically, for our proposed in-context attack and defense, we collect demonstrations from broad types of tasks from chat but at a specific safety level, which are detailed in the following.
LLMs 的这一神秘特性已吸引大量研究关注如何设计此类情境演示以提升学习性能[57,44,14,45,32,50]。然而，与现有工作主要侧重于利用 ICL 提升特定任务（如分类）的性能不同，我们的工作聚焦于描述演示在操控 LLMs 在不同类型任务中的安全水平方面的能力，这可被视为一种更一般的能力。具体而言，针对我们提出的情境攻击与防御，我们从聊天中收集多种任务类型的演示，但保持特定的安全水平，详情如下。

3.2 In-Context Attack  3.2 情境攻击

In this section, we propose an In-Context Attack (ICA) on aligned LLMs. Since LLMs can efficiently learn a specific task through only a few in-context demonstrations, we wonder whether they can learn to behave maliciously through a set of harmful demonstrations.
在本节中，我们针对对齐的 LLMs 提出了一种情境攻击（ICA）。由于 LLMs 仅通过少量情境演示就能高效学习特定任务，我们不禁思考它们是否可以通过一组有害演示来学习恶意行为。

Motivated by this notion, we propose to craft a harmful demonstration set consisting of a few query-response pairs that the language model answers some toxic requests, as illustrated in Algorithm 1. Specifically, before prompting the model with the target attack request 𝒙𝒙\boldsymbol{x}bold_italic_x, we first collect some other harmful prompts {xi}subscript𝑥𝑖\{x_{i}\}{ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } (can be manually written or from adversarial prompt datasets like advbench [61]) and their corresponding harmful outputs {yi}subscript𝑦𝑖\{y_{i}\}{ italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } (can also be manually written or from attacking a surrogate model with xisubscript𝑥𝑖x_{i}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT) as the harmful demonstrations. Then, by concatenating the demonstrations [x1,y1,⋯,xk,yk]subscript𝑥1subscript𝑦1⋯subscript𝑥𝑘subscript𝑦𝑘[x_{1},y_{1},\cdots,x_{k},y_{k}][ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋯ , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] and the target attack prompt 𝒙𝒙\boldsymbol{x}bold_italic_x, we obtain the final attack prompt Pattack=[x1,y1,⋯,xk,yk,𝒙]subscript𝑃attacksubscript𝑥1subscript𝑦1⋯subscript𝑥𝑘subscript𝑦𝑘𝒙P_{\text{attack}}=[x_{1},y_{1},\cdots,x_{k},y_{k},\boldsymbol{x}]italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT attack end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = [ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋯ , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_italic_x ]. By prompting Pattacksubscript𝑃attackP_{\text{attack}}italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT attack end_POSTSUBSCRIPT to the victim LLM, our proposed ICA can successfully get the target harmful response of request 𝒙𝒙\boldsymbol{x}bold_italic_x. Examples of ICA prompt are in Appendix B.
基于这一理念，我们提出构建一个有害演示集，其中包含少量查询-响应对，使语言模型回答一些有害请求，如算法 1 所示。具体来说，在用目标攻击请求 𝒙\boldsymbol{x}bold_italic_x 提示模型之前，我们首先收集一些其他有害提示 {xi}subscript\{x_{i}\}{ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } （可以是手动编写的，或来自对抗性提示数据集 advbench [ 61]）及其对应的有害输出 {yi}subscript\{y_{i}\}{ italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } （也可以是手动编写的，或通过 xisubscriptx_{i}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT 攻击替代模型获得），作为有害演示。然后，通过连接演示 [x1,y1,⋯,xk,yk]subscript1subscript1subscriptsubscript[x_{1},y_{1},\cdots,x_{k},y_{k}][ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋯ , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] 和目标攻击提示 𝒙\boldsymbol{x}bold_italic_x ，我们得到最终的攻击提示 Pattack=[x1,y1,⋯,xk,yk,𝒙]subscriptsubscript1subscript1subscriptsubscriptP_{\text{attack}}=[x_{1},y_{1},\cdots,x_{k},y_{k},\boldsymbol{x}]italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT attack end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = [ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋯ , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_italic_x ] 。通过将 PattacksubscriptP_{\text{attack}}italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT attack end_POSTSUBSCRIPT 提示给受害者 LLM，我们提出的方法 ICA 可以成功获得请求 𝒙\boldsymbol{x}bold_italic_x 的目标有害响应。ICA 提示的示例在附录 B 中。

Discussion. We highlight the proposed ICA enjoys several advantages as follows: 1) Universality. To attack different models and harmful prompts, the attacker only needs to generate the demonstrations for the adversarial demonstration set [x1,y1,x2,y2,⋯,xk,yk]subscript𝑥1subscript𝑦1subscript𝑥2subscript𝑦2⋯subscript𝑥𝑘subscript𝑦𝑘[x_{1},y_{1},x_{2},y_{2},\cdots,x_{k},y_{k}][ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋯ , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] once and apply it to attack the model with different other prompts. 2) Efficiency. Different from optimization-based attack methods like GCG and AutoDAN which require hundreds of forward or backward passes, ICA only needs a single forward pass to attack a single prompt. 3) Stealthy. While adversarial suffix attacks [61, 60] may be easily detected with a simple perplexity filter [1, 16], the prompt of ICA is thoroughly in a natural language form and cannot be easily detected.
讨论。我们强调所提出的 ICA 具有以下几个优点：1）通用性。为了攻击不同的模型和有害提示，攻击者只需要生成一次对抗性演示集 [x1,y1,x2,y2,⋯,xk,yk]subscript1subscript1subscript2subscript2subscriptsubscript[x_{1},y_{1},x_{2},y_{2},\cdots,x_{k},y_{k}][ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋯ , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] 的演示，并将其应用于使用不同其他提示攻击模型。2）效率。与需要数百次前向或后向传递的基于优化的攻击方法（如 GCG 和 AutoDAN）不同，ICA 只需要一次前向传递即可攻击单个提示。3）隐蔽性。虽然对抗性后缀攻击[ 61, 60]可能很容易被简单的困惑度过滤器[ 1, 16]检测到，但 ICA 的提示完全以自然语言形式存在，并且很难被检测到。

3.3 In-Context Defense  3.3 上下文防御

Similar to our proposed ICA, we also explore whether a few safe demonstrations can enhance the robustness of LLMs against jailbreak attacks. In this section, we propose an In-Context Defense (ICD) approach that crafts a set of safe demonstrations to guard the model not to generate anything harmful. Contrary to ICA, ICD uses the desired safe response in the demonstrations that refuse to answer harmful requests. To be specific, we still first collect a set of malicious requests {xi}subscript𝑥𝑖\{x_{i}\}{ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } and the corresponding safe responses {yi}subscript𝑦𝑖\{y_{i}\}{ italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } to craft the demonstrations. Similar to ICA, the requests {xi}subscript𝑥𝑖\{x_{i}\}{ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } can be collected from harmful prompt datasets, and the safe responses {yi}subscript𝑦𝑖\{y_{i}\}{ italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } can be collected by directly prompting {xi}subscript𝑥𝑖\{x_{i}\}{ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } to the aligned model without attack. Finally, by appending these demonstrations to the conversation template of the defense target LLM f⁢(⋅)𝑓⋅f(\cdot)italic_f ( ⋅ ), we transform it into a more safe and robust language model g⁢(⋅)=f⁢([x1,y1,x2,y2,⋯,xk,yk,⋅])𝑔⋅𝑓subscript𝑥1subscript𝑦1subscript𝑥2subscript𝑦2⋯subscript𝑥𝑘subscript𝑦𝑘⋅g(\cdot)=f([x_{1},y_{1},x_{2},y_{2},\cdots,x_{k},y_{k},\cdot])italic_g ( ⋅ ) = italic_f ( [ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋯ , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋅ ] ). For any user query 𝒙𝒙\boldsymbol{x}bold_italic_x, the model developer returns the response of the LLM by prompting Px=[x1,y1,x2,y2,⋯,xk,yk,𝒙]subscript𝑃𝑥subscript𝑥1subscript𝑦1subscript𝑥2subscript𝑦2⋯subscript𝑥𝑘subscript𝑦𝑘𝒙P_{x}=[x_{1},y_{1},x_{2},y_{2},\cdots,x_{k},y_{k},\boldsymbol{x}]italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = [ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋯ , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_italic_x ] as detailed in Algorithm 2. An example of ICD prompt is shown in Appendix C.
与我们所提出的 ICA 类似，我们也探索了少量安全示例是否能够增强 LLMs 对越狱攻击的鲁棒性。在本节中，我们提出了一种情境内防御（ICD）方法，该方法构建一组安全示例来保护模型不生成任何有害内容。与 ICA 不同，ICD 在拒绝回答有害请求的示例中使用期望的安全响应。具体来说，我们仍然首先收集一组恶意请求 {xi}subscript\{x_{i}\}{ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } 及其对应的安全响应 {yi}subscript\{y_{i}\}{ italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } 来构建示例。类似于 ICA，请求 {xi}subscript\{x_{i}\}{ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } 可以从有害提示数据集中收集，安全响应 {yi}subscript\{y_{i}\}{ italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } 可以通过直接将 {xi}subscript\{x_{i}\}{ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } 提示给对齐模型而不进行攻击来收集。最后，通过将这些示例附加到防御目标 LLM f⁢(⋅)f(\cdot)italic_f ( ⋅ ) 的对话模板中，我们将它转化为一个更安全、更鲁棒的语言模型 g⁢(⋅)=f⁢([x1,y1,x2,y2,⋯,xk,yk,⋅])subscript1subscript1subscript2subscript2subscriptsubscriptg(\cdot)=f([x_{1},y_{1},x_{2},y_{2},\cdots,x_{k},y_{k},\cdot])italic_g ( ⋅ ) = italic_f ( [ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋯ , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋅ ] ) 。对于任何用户查询 𝒙\boldsymbol{x}bold_italic_x ，模型开发者通过算法 2 中详细说明的 Px=[x1,y1,x2,y2,⋯,xk,yk,𝒙]subscriptsubscript1subscript1subscript2subscript2subscriptsubscriptP_{x}=[x_{1},y_{1},x_{2},y_{2},\cdots,x_{k},y_{k},\boldsymbol{x}]italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = [ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋯ , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_italic_x ] 提示来返回 LLM 的响应。ICD 提示的一个示例显示在附录 C 中。

Discussion. We also highlight several properties of ICD compared to other defense methods: 1) Model-agnostic. Since ICD only requires the conversation API of the target LLM, it does not need access to the model parameters like perplexity filter [16] or modify the internal generation logic like RAIN [25], and even not need to change the system message like self-reminders [49]. Thus, ICD can be easily deployed for AI-plugin products by simply adding these demonstrations to the conversation, which is particularly useful for downstream tasks. 2) Efficiency. Since ICD only adds a few demonstrations to the conversation template, it only requires negligible computational overhead (no more than 2%). 3) Harmless. While existing defense methods, particularly filter-based [1] and detection-based [22, 16], are known to may cause unaffordable false positive cases that reject benign prompts, our proposed ICD does not have this concern. In our experiments, we evaluate ICD with GLUE [43] and MT-bench [59] to show that ICD does not hurt natural performance.
讨论。我们还强调了 ICD 与其他防御方法相比的几个特性：1) 模型无关性。由于 ICD 只需要目标 LLM 的对话 API，因此它不需要访问模型参数（如困惑度过滤器[16]）或修改内部生成逻辑（如 RAIN[25]），甚至不需要更改系统消息（如自我提醒[49]）。因此，ICD 可以通过简单地将这些演示添加到对话中，轻松部署到 AI 插件产品中，这对于下游任务特别有用。2) 效率。由于 ICD 仅向对话模板中添加少量演示，因此它仅需微不足道的计算开销（不超过 2%）。3) 无害性。虽然现有的防御方法，特别是基于过滤器的[1]和基于检测的[22, 16]，已知可能导致无法承受的误报情况，拒绝良性提示，但我们提出的 ICD 没有这方面的担忧。在我们的实验中，我们使用 GLUE[43]和 MT-bench[59]评估 ICD，以证明 ICD 不会损害自然性能。

4 Theoretical Insights on Adversarial Demonstrations
4 对抗性演示的理论见解

In this section, we provide insights into understanding how in-context demonstration can manipulate the safety of LLMs. First, we provide a hypothetical framework for decoupling safe and harmful language distributions, then show how adversarial demonstrations can guide the model generation bias to the target distribution (harmful or safe).
在本节中，我们探讨了如何通过情境演示来操控 LLMs 的安全性。首先，我们提供了一个将安全语言分布和有害语言分布解耦的假设框架，然后展示了对抗性演示如何将模型生成偏差引导至目标分布（有害或安全）。

4.1 Problem Formulation  4.1 问题公式化

Decoupling language model distributions. Generally, the safety training and fine-tuning of LLMs encourage λ𝜆\lambdaitalic_λ as small as possible to reduce the harmful generation probability. However, due to the complexity of natural languages and the existence of toxic context in the training set, it is idealistic to make λ=0𝜆0\lambda=0italic_λ = 0 exactly [48]. The following R⁢(⋅)𝑅⋅R(\cdot)italic_R ( ⋅ ) and ℛ⁢(⋅)ℛ⋅\mathcal{R}(\cdot)caligraphic_R ( ⋅ ) describes the harmfulness of a given sentence and prompt:

To study how adversarial demonstrations impact the safety of the LLM, we make several assumptions in the following. First, since we focus on the conversation scenario and the difference between the two distributions only lies in the response, we have the following assumption that the probability of each request prompt is the same for the two distributions:

4.2 Main Results  4.2 主要结果

Based on the aforementioned assumptions, in the following theorem we show that it is possible to manipulate the generation safety risk through a few harmful or safe demonstrations:
基于上述假设，在以下定理中，我们证明通过少量有害或安全的演示，可以操纵生成安全风险：

This theorem shows that for the queried harmful request q𝑞qitalic_q, to achieve comparable harmfulness with prompting the q𝑞qitalic_q in the harmful distribution ℙHsubscriptℙ𝐻\mathbb{P}_{H}blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, i.e. higher than ℛℙH⁢(q)−ϵsubscriptℛsubscriptℙ𝐻𝑞italic-ϵ\mathcal{R}_{\mathbb{P}_{H}}(q)-\epsiloncaligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_q ) - italic_ϵ, it only requires 𝒪⁢(ln⁡1λ+ln⁡1ϵ)𝒪1𝜆1italic-ϵ\mathcal{O}(\ln\frac{1}{\lambda}+\ln\frac{1}{\epsilon})caligraphic_O ( roman_ln divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG + roman_ln divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_ϵ end_ARG ) demonstrations that on a logarithmic scale of 1ϵ1italic-ϵ\frac{1}{\epsilon}divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_ϵ end_ARG and 1λ1𝜆\frac{1}{\lambda}divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG, where 1λ1𝜆\frac{1}{\lambda}divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG measures the intrinsic safety of the model and 1ϵ1italic-ϵ\frac{1}{\epsilon}divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_ϵ end_ARG measures how close is the safety risk to the harmful distribution. In contrast, decreasing the risk level of q𝑞qitalic_q comparable with the safe distribution, i.e. ℛℙS⁢(q)+ϵsubscriptℛsubscriptℙ𝑆𝑞italic-ϵ\mathcal{R}_{\mathbb{P}_{S}}(q)+\epsiloncaligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_q ) + italic_ϵ, only requires 𝒪⁢(ln⁡11−λ+ln⁡1ϵ)𝒪11𝜆1italic-ϵ\mathcal{O}(\ln\frac{1}{1-\lambda}+\ln\frac{1}{\epsilon})caligraphic_O ( roman_ln divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_λ end_ARG + roman_ln divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_ϵ end_ARG ) demonstrations. Notably, since for aligned models the λ𝜆\lambdaitalic_λ tends to 0, the term ln⁡11−λ11𝜆\ln\frac{1}{1-\lambda}roman_ln divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_λ end_ARG may be significantly smaller than ln⁡1λ1𝜆\ln\frac{1}{\lambda}roman_ln divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG. This notion aligns well with our experiment in the following section, where the number of demonstrations we used in ICD (1-2 shots) is significantly less than in ICA.
定理 4.5 的证明详见附录 A。该定理表明，对于查询的有害请求 qqitalic_q ，要实现与在有害分布 ℙHsubscript\mathbb{P}_{H}blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT 中提示 qqitalic_q 相当的有害程度，即高于 ℛℙH⁢(q)−ϵsubscriptsubscript\mathcal{R}_{\mathbb{P}_{H}}(q)-\epsiloncaligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_q ) - italic_ϵ ，只需要 𝒪⁢(ln⁡1λ+ln⁡1ϵ)11\mathcal{O}(\ln\frac{1}{\lambda}+\ln\frac{1}{\epsilon})caligraphic_O ( roman_ln divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG + roman_ln divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_ϵ end_ARG ) 个演示，这些演示在对数尺度 1ϵ1\frac{1}{\epsilon}divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_ϵ end_ARG 和 1λ1\frac{1}{\lambda}divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG 上，其中 1λ1\frac{1}{\lambda}divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG 衡量模型的内在安全性， 1ϵ1\frac{1}{\epsilon}divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_ϵ end_ARG 衡量安全风险与有害分布的接近程度。相比之下，降低 qqitalic_q 的风险水平至与安全分布相当，即 ℛℙS⁢(q)+ϵsubscriptsubscript\mathcal{R}_{\mathbb{P}_{S}}(q)+\epsiloncaligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_q ) + italic_ϵ ，只需要 𝒪⁢(ln⁡11−λ+ln⁡1ϵ)111\mathcal{O}(\ln\frac{1}{1-\lambda}+\ln\frac{1}{\epsilon})caligraphic_O ( roman_ln divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_λ end_ARG + roman_ln divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_ϵ end_ARG ) 个演示。值得注意的是，由于对于对齐模型来说 λ\lambdaitalic_λ 趋于 0，因此项 ln⁡11−λ11\ln\frac{1}{1-\lambda}roman_ln divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_λ end_ARG 可能远小于 ln⁡1λ1\ln\frac{1}{\lambda}roman_ln divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG 。这一观点与我们在下一节中的实验结果高度吻合，在那里我们用于 ICD（1-2 次射击）的演示数量明显少于 ICA。

5 Experiments  5 实验

5.1 Overall Evaluation Setups
5.1 总体评估设置

Models and benchmarks. Following common practice [61, 27, 9], we mainly evaluate our proposed attack and defense on 4 popular aligned LLMs, including 3 open-sourced models (Vicuna-7b-v1.5 [59], Llama2-7b-chat [41], and QWen-7b-v2 [4]) and 1 closed-sourced model (GPT-4 0613 [33]). For the malicious requests, we use AdvBench [61] which consists of about 500 harmful behavior prompts. To further validate the effectiveness of ICA, we also implement our attack on the official repository of HarmBench [30], which is a new benchmark for evaluating red-teaming methods through harmful contextual and copyright behaviors. However, we only use AdvBench for ICD evaluation since HarmBench did not provide defense implementation platforms. The generation configurations and system messages are kept the same as the official implementations.
模型与基准。遵循常见做法[ 61, 27, 9]，我们主要在 4 个流行的对齐 LLMs 上评估我们提出的攻击与防御，包括 3 个开源模型（Vicuna-7b-v1.5 [ 59]、Llama2-7b-chat [ 41]和 QWen-7b-v2 [ 4]）以及 1 个闭源模型（GPT-4 0613 [ 33]）。对于恶意请求，我们使用 AdvBench [ 61]，它包含约 500 个有害行为提示。为了进一步验证 ICA 的有效性，我们还将在 HarmBench [ 30]的官方仓库上实现我们的攻击，HarmBench 是一个用于通过有害上下文和版权行为评估红队方法的最新基准。然而，由于 HarmBench 没有提供防御实现平台，我们仅使用 AdvBench 进行 ICD 评估。生成配置和系统消息与官方实现保持一致。

Evaluation metric. Following GCG and subsequent works [61, 27, 60], for attack success rate (ASR) evaluation on AdvBench we apply rejection string detection (i.e., whether the response includes a rejection sub-string like ‘I cannot’, more details in Appendix D) to judge the success of jailbreak. However, as agreed by previous work  [28, 24], the string detection may not be fully reliable. Therefore, following the evaluation metric of Harmbench [30], we also use their fine-tuned judging model (from Llama-13b) to recheck the harmfulness of a generated response. Specifically, we use both the language model and string detection to judge the generated content. In exceptional cases in which there is a conflict, human evaluation is involved to manually check and give the final judgment. For the HarmBench evaluation, we directly use the LLM judgment provided by their official implementation to ensure a fair comparison with existing baselines.
评估指标。遵循 GCG 及后续工作[ 61, 27, 60]，在 AdvBench 上评估攻击成功率（ASR）时，我们采用拒绝字符串检测（即判断响应是否包含拒绝子字符串如“我无法”，更多细节见附录 D）来判定越狱是否成功。然而，如先前工作[ 28, 24]所共识，字符串检测可能并非完全可靠。因此，遵循 Harmbench[ 30]的评估指标，我们也使用其微调的判断模型（基于 Llama-13b）重新检查生成响应的危害性。具体而言，我们结合语言模型和字符串检测来判定生成内容。在存在冲突的例外情况下，会引入人工评估进行手动核查并给出最终判断。对于 HarmBench 评估，我们直接使用其官方实现提供的 LLM 判断结果，以确保与现有基线的公平比较。

Adversarial demonstrations. As discussed in Section 3, the demonstrations for ICA can be collected manually or automatically generated from jailbreak prompts. In our experiments, we randomly select 20 harmful requests from AdvBench and craft the corresponding harmful content with GCG attack on vicuna-7b to generate the harmful demonstrations for ICA, while for ICD, we collect the safe demonstration by prompting the vanilla harmful requests. We repeat this procedure three times to report the average ASR for all experiments.
对抗性演示。如第 3 节所述，ICA 的演示可以手动收集或通过越狱提示自动生成。在我们的实验中，我们从 AdvBench 中随机选择 20 个有害请求，并使用 GCG 攻击在 vicuna-7b 上制作相应的有害内容，以生成 ICA 的有害演示；而对于 ICD，我们通过提示普通的 harmful 请求来收集安全演示。我们重复此过程三次，以报告所有实验的平均 ASR。

5.2 Attack Evaluation  5.2 攻击评估

We conduct experiments to validate the effectiveness of ICA in the following. First, we examine ICA with different numbers of shots to reveal that only a few shots of harmful demonstrations can jailbreak LLMs efficiently, then compare ICA with some advanced methods to show ICA can achieve comparable ASR with them.
我们进行实验以验证 ICA 的有效性。首先，我们使用不同数量的 shots 来检验 ICA，揭示只有少量有害的演示就能高效地越狱 LLMs，然后将 ICA 与一些先进方法进行比较，以表明 ICA 可以与他们实现相当的 ASR。

Number of shots. We consider applying ICA with {1,5,10,15,20}15101520\{1,5,10,15,20\}{ 1 , 5 , 10 , 15 , 20 } shots to attack the evaluation models and summarize the results in Table 1. With only a single (1 shot) ICA demonstration, we can increase the ASR from 1% to 8% for Vicuna on AdvBench, and from 3% to 19% for Llama-2 on HarmBench, showing the potential of such a form of attack. As the number of demonstrations increases to 10, ICA significantly increases the ASR to 87% for vicuna and also successfully jailbreaks the closed-source model GPT-4 with a 46% ASR, validating that more harmful demonstrations can further boost the strength of the attack. We finally tried to scale up the numbers of demonstrations to 15 and 20 shots to sufficiently utilize the context window, where the ASRs on GPT-4 can be increased to 81% and 65% on the two datasets, respectfully. However, for the three 7b-size open-source models, their context windows are relatively limited (4096 tokens) and can only accommodate 15-shot ICA (10-shot for Llama-2 due to its very long system message), but the ASRs of ICA are still improved.
样本数量。我们考虑使用 {1,5,10,15,20}15101520\{1,5,10,15,20\}{ 1 , 5 , 10 , 15 , 20 } 个样本应用 ICA 来攻击评估模型，并将结果总结在表 1 中。仅使用单个（1 个）ICA 示例，我们可以在 AdvBench 上将 Vicuna 的 ASR 从 1%提高到 8%，在 HarmBench 上将 Llama-2 的 ASR 从 3%提高到 19%，显示出这种攻击形式的潜力。随着示例数量的增加到 10 个，ICA 显著将 Vicuna 的 ASR 提高到 87%，并且还成功破解了闭源模型 GPT-4，ASR 达到 46%，验证了更多有害示例可以进一步增强攻击的强度。我们最后尝试将示例数量增加到 15 个和 20 个，以充分利用上下文窗口，在两个数据集上 GPT-4 的 ASR 分别提高到 81%和 65%。然而，对于三个 7b 大小的开源模型，它们的上下文窗口相对有限（4096 个 token），只能容纳 15 个样本的 ICA（Llama-2 为 10 个样本，由于其系统消息非常长），但 ICA 的 ASR 仍然得到了提升。

Benchmark results. To further validate the effectiveness of ICA, we also compare ICA with some advanced jailbreak attacks on HarmBench [30], including white-box {GCG, GCG-multiple (GCG-M) [61], AutoDAN [27]} and black-box {GCG-transfer (GCG-T) [61], PAIR [9], TAP [31]}. To ensure a fair comparison, we implemented ICA on the official repository of HarmBench with the default generation configurations and the maximum number of shots, then compared the results reported on the benchmark111https://www.harmbench.org/results
基准测试结果。为了进一步验证 ICA 的有效性，我们还将 ICA 与 HarmBench [ 30]上的一些高级越狱攻击进行了比较，包括白盒{GCG, GCG-multiple (GCG-M) [ 61], AutoDAN [ 27]}和黑盒{GCG-transfer (GCG-T) [ 61], PAIR [ 9], TAP [ 31]}。为确保公平比较，我们在 HarmBench 的官方代码库中使用默认生成配置和最大样本数量实现了 ICA，然后比较了基准测试 1 上报告的结果。, as summarized in Table 2. We also involved more models to justify the universality of ICA, including vicuna-13b-v1.5 [59], Mistral-7b-v2 [18] and Mistral-8x7b [19]. The average ASR is calculated over 5 white-box models. From these results, we can see that our ICA achieves about 60% ASR on white-box models on average, and also archives higher than 65% ASR on black-box models, uniformly performing comparable to or better than existing advanced methods, which often require heavy optimization processes.
如表 2 所示总结。我们还涉及更多模型来论证 ICA 的普适性，包括 vicuna-13b-v1.5 [ 59]、Mistral-7b-v2 [ 18]和 Mistral-8x7b [ 19]。平均 ASR 是在 5 个白盒模型上计算的。从这些结果可以看出，我们的 ICA 在白盒模型上平均实现了约 60%的 ASR，同时在黑盒模型上也实现了超过 65%的 ASR，其表现始终与现有先进方法相当或更优，而现有方法通常需要复杂的优化过程。

5.3 Defense Evaluation  5.3 防御评估

On the other hand, we conduct comprehensive evaluations to show how our ICD can mitigate jailbreak threats of LLMs while maintaining their natural performance, demonstrating its strong potential to be a practical defense technique in practical settings.
另一方面，我们进行全面的评估，以展示我们的 ICD 如何在保持 LLMs 自然性能的同时减轻其被越狱的威胁，证明其在实际场景中作为实用防御技术的强大潜力。

Attacks for evaluation. To show the effectiveness of ICD in terms of defending against various types of jailbreaking attacks, following the similar setting of ICA, we evaluate ICD with various popular attacks, including GCG-T, PAIR (black-box), GCG, and AutoDAN (white-box). For GCG-T, the transferred suffix for open-source models (Vicuna, Llama-2, QWen) is trained with the other 2 models ensembled with 100 steps GCG, and for GPT-4 is trained with the 3 models ensembled. For PAIR, we follow the official implementation that uses 20 steps and the same model as the red-teaming LLM. Following AutoDAN [27], we apply 100 steps for optimization for both AutoDAN prefix and GCG suffix generation with the default hyper-parameters in the official implementation.
评估攻击。为了展示 ICD 在防御各种类型的越狱攻击方面的有效性，我们遵循与 ICA 类似的设置，使用各种流行的攻击方法评估 ICD，包括 GCG-T、PAIR（黑盒）、GCG 和 AutoDAN（白盒）。对于 GCG-T，开源模型（Vicuna、Llama-2、QWen）的迁移后缀使用其他 2 个模型与 100 步 GCG 集成训练，而 GPT-4 则使用 3 个模型集成训练。对于 PAIR，我们遵循官方实现，使用 20 步和与红队 LLM 相同的模型。遵循 AutoDAN [27]，我们使用官方实现中的默认超参数，对 AutoDAN 前缀和 GCG 后缀生成分别进行 100 步优化。

ICD and baselines. For the demonstrations used in ICD, we still randomly select malicious requests from AdvBench and use Vicuna to generate safe demonstrations by directly prompting the request without attack. However, we show that only 1 or 2 demonstrations are sufficient to decrease the ASR of various attacks to a certain extent, which is much fewer than ICA. Example demonstrations used in ICD are available in Appendix C. Since our ICD is a prompt-based defense method, we also compare it with Self-Reminder [49] which adds a safe instruction that reminds the LLM to generate safe content only in the system message as a baseline. However, as discussed our ICD only requires adding conversations and does not require access to the system prompt.
ICD 和基线。对于 ICD 中使用的演示，我们仍然从 AdvBench 中随机选择恶意请求，并使用 Vicuna 通过直接提示请求（不进行攻击）来生成安全演示。然而，我们表明仅 1 或 2 个演示就足以在一定程度上降低各种攻击的 ASR，这远少于 ICA。ICD 中使用的示例演示可在附录 C 中找到。由于我们的 ICD 是一种基于提示的防御方法，我们也将其与 Self-Reminder [49]进行比较，Self-Reminder [49]在系统消息中添加了一个安全指令，提醒 LLM 仅生成安全内容作为基线。然而，正如我们讨论的那样，ICD 仅需要添加对话，而不需要访问系统提示。

Defending against Black-box attacks. We compare the ASR evaluated under GCG-T and PAIR for the 4 models with different defenses in Table 3. Without any defense, the models exhibit fairly high ASR, particularly for the relatively weak Vicuna that achieves about 60% under the two attacks. Though Self-Reminder can reduce the ASRs to a certain degree, in most cases it remains undesired like Vicuna still has 39% against GCG-T. By contrast, with only a single safe demonstration incorporated into the context, ICD can significantly reduce the ASR (e.g. to 12% in the aforementioned case) on average, and further decrease it to nearly 0% in most cases when 2 shot demonstrations are applied, showing the promising robustness against black-box jailbreak attacks.
防御黑盒攻击。我们在表 3 中比较了在 GCG-T 和 PAIR 下，针对 4 种不同防御模型的 ASR 评估结果。在没有任何防御的情况下，模型的 ASR 表现相当高，尤其是相对较弱的 Vicuna 在两种攻击下 ASR 达到了约 60%。尽管 Self-Reminder 能在一定程度上降低 ASR，但在大多数情况下仍然不尽如人意，例如 Vicuna 在 GCG-T 攻击下仍有 39%的 ASR。相比之下，仅将一个安全的演示整合到上下文中，ICD 就能显著降低平均 ASR（例如，在上述情况下降至 12%），并且当应用 2 shot 演示时，大多数情况下 ASR 进一步降低至接近 0%，显示出对黑盒越狱攻击的良好鲁棒性。

Defending against White-box (Adaptive) attacks. To explore the worst-case performance of ICD, we also evaluate it with white-box adaptive attacks including GCG and AutoDAN. Please note that AutoDAN is a white-box attack since the leveraged cross-entropy loss requires logits over tokens during generation. During the optimization process of the suffix and prefix, we incorporate the safe demonstrations when responding to the attack query, so the evaluation of ICD is fully adaptive.
防御白盒（自适应）攻击。为了探索 ICD 的最坏情况性能，我们还使用包括 GCG 和 AutoDAN 在内的白盒自适应攻击对其进行评估。请注意，AutoDAN 是一种白盒攻击，因为它在生成过程中利用交叉熵损失需要基于 token 的 logits。在优化后缀和前缀的过程中，我们在响应攻击查询时结合了安全示例，因此 ICD 的评估是完全自适应的。

The evaluation results are shown in Table 4. Given the strong capabilities of the attackers, the ASRs under these attacks are significantly high without defense, and the effectiveness of Self-reminder becomes more limited than black-box settings. However, our ICD can still notably reduce these ASRs to a certain extent, e.g. reduce the average ASR of GCG from 65% to 40% on average with 2 shots. These results evidence that ICD is still effective even against strong adaptive attacks.
评估结果如表 4 所示。鉴于攻击者的强大能力，在这些攻击下，未采取防御措施的语音识别率显著较高，而 Self-reminder 在黑盒设置下的有效性变得更加有限。然而，我们的 ICD 仍然可以显著降低这些语音识别率，例如，使用 2 次示例平均将 GCG 的平均语音识别率从 65%降低到 40%。这些结果表明，即使面对强大的自适应攻击，ICD 仍然有效。

Natural Performance. We evaluate the natural performance of ICD compared to vanilla generation. Following Self-Reminder [49], we also evaluate the models under defense methods across several tasks from the GLUE benchmark [43], a classic multi-task benchmark for language models. Besides, we also consider MT-bench [59] which evaluates the instruction-following capability and generation helpfulness of LLMs. We evaluate vanilla generation and ICD with these benchmarks with both open-source (Vicuna) and close-source (GPT-4) models and report the results in Table 5, where the natural performance of ICD is still comparable with vanilla generation. In some cases, the score of ICD is even slightly better than the vanilla generation, e.g. GPT-4 with 2-shots ICD (9.24) performs better than vanilla (8.89) on MT-Bench, which we identify as an intriguing property and worth further investigations.
自然性能。我们评估了 ICD 与普通生成在自然性能方面的表现。遵循 Self-Reminder [ 49]，我们还评估了模型在 GLUE 基准测试[ 43]下的表现，GLUE 是一个经典的用于语言模型的多任务基准测试。此外，我们还考虑了 MT-bench [ 59]，它评估了 LLMs 的指令跟随能力和生成帮助性。我们使用这些基准测试评估了普通生成和 ICD，包括开源（Vicuna）和闭源（GPT-4）模型，并将结果报告在表 5 中，其中 ICD 的自然性能与普通生成仍然相当。在某些情况下，ICD 的得分甚至略好于普通生成，例如 GPT-4 使用 2-shots ICD（9.24）在 MT-Bench 上的表现优于普通生成（8.89），我们认为这是一个有趣的特点，值得进一步研究。

We also estimate the computation cost of ICD and compare it with the vanilla generation, as shown in Table 5. The generation time is averaged on all prompts in GLUE and MT-bench datasets. Compared with the baseline, Vicuna with 2 shots ICD only increases 2% computational overhead, while the cost for GPT is less than 1%. To summarize, we can conclude that ICD has only negligible influence on natural generation, making it an admissible defense technique against jailbreak attacks.
我们还估算了 ICD 的计算成本，并将其与普通生成进行比较，如表 5 所示。生成时间是在 GLUE 和 MT-bench 数据集的所有提示上取平均的。与基线相比，带有 2 次示例 ICD 的 Vicuna 仅增加了 2%的计算开销，而 GPT 的成本不到 1%。总结来说，我们可以得出结论，ICD 对自然生成的影响微乎其微，使其成为一种对抗越狱攻击的可接受防御技术。

Evaluating ICD v.s. ICA. We also further explore how the aligned LLMs perform when ICA is leveraged to attack ICD, where the prompt is organized as starting with safe demonstrations (added by the model developer) and followed by harmful demonstrations (added by the attacker). We evaluate this on Vicuna-7b and report the results in Table 6, where we can see that when the attacker only uses 1 shot harmful demonstration, ICD with similar numbers of demonstrations can easily eliminate the threat. However, when the attack’s capacity scales up to 5 or 10 shots, the harmful demonstrations can subvert the safe ones, maintaining a fairly high ASR. Nevertheless, ICD is still useful in this setting as it can anyway reduce the harmfulness with less capacity. On the other hand, it is also possible to attach the safe demonstrations behind the existing conversations as a defense against ICA.
评估 ICD 与 ICA。我们还进一步探讨了当 ICA 被用来攻击 ICD 时，对齐的 LLMs 的表现如何，其中提示词的编排方式是先添加由模型开发者添加的安全示例，然后添加由攻击者添加的有害示例。我们在 Vicuna-7b 上评估了这种情况，并将结果报告在表 6 中，我们可以看到，当攻击者仅使用 1 次有害示例时，具有相似数量示例的 ICD 可以轻易消除威胁。然而，当攻击能力扩展到 5 次或 10 次时，有害示例可以颠覆安全示例，保持相对较高的 ASR。尽管如此，在这种设置下 ICD 仍然有用，因为它无论如何都能以较低的能力减少有害性。另一方面，也可以将安全示例附加在现有对话后面，作为防御 ICA 的一种方法。

Overall, our proposed ICA and ICD show strong potential for attacking and defending against LLMs, providing new avenues for safety research on LLMs.
总体而言，我们提出的 ICA 和 ICD 在攻击和防御 LLMs 方面展现出巨大潜力，为 LLMs 安全研究提供了新的途径。

6 Conclusion  6 结论

In this paper, we uncover the power of in-context demonstrations in manipulating the alignment ability of LLMs for both attack and defense purposes by the proposed two techniques: In-Context Attack (ICA) and In-Context Defense (ICD). For ICA, we show that a few demonstrations of responding to malicious prompts can jailbreak the model to generate harmful content. On the other hand, ICD enhances model robustness by demonstrations of rejecting harmful prompts. We also provide theoretical justifications to understand the effectiveness of only a few adversarial demonstrations. Our comprehensive evaluations illustrate the practicality and effectiveness of ICA and ICD, highlighting their significant potential on LLMs alignment and security and providing a new perspective to study this issue.
在本文中，我们通过提出的两种技术——情境攻击（ICA）和情境防御（ICD），揭示了情境演示在攻击和防御目的上操纵 LLMs 对齐能力的作用。对于 ICA，我们证明少量针对恶意提示的响应演示可以使模型生成有害内容。另一方面，ICD 通过拒绝有害提示的演示增强了模型的鲁棒性。我们还提供了理论依据来理解仅少量对抗性演示的有效性。我们的综合评估说明了 ICA 和 ICD 的实用性和有效性，突出了它们在 LLMs 对齐和安全方面的巨大潜力，并为研究这一问题提供了新的视角。

Proof for Theorem 4.5.  定理 4.5 的证明。

Appendix D Evaluation Details
附录 D 评估细节

Following AutoDAN [27], we apply a double-check method that consists of (1) rejection string detection, and (2) LLM evaluation to judge whether a jailbreak success. Exceptional cases with a conflict between them will be manually checked to reach a decision. We apply the same set of rejection strings as AutoDAN [27], which is listed below.
遵循 AutoDAN [ 27]，我们采用一种双重检查方法，包括（1）拒绝字符串检测，以及（2）LLM 评估来判断是否成功越狱。当两者存在冲突的异常情况时，将人工检查以做出决定。我们使用与 AutoDAN [ 27] 相同的拒绝字符串集，如下所示。

Instructions for reporting errors

We are continuing to improve HTML versions of papers, and your feedback helps enhance accessibility and mobile support. To report errors in the HTML that will help us improve conversion and rendering, choose any of the methods listed below:

  • Click the "Report Issue" button.
  • Open a report feedback form via keyboard, use "Ctrl + ?".
  • Make a text selection and click the "Report Issue for Selection" button near your cursor.
  • You can use Alt+Y to toggle on and Alt+Shift+Y to toggle off accessible reporting links at each section.

Our team has already identified the following issues. We appreciate your time reviewing and reporting rendering errors we may not have found yet. Your efforts will help us improve the HTML versions for all readers, because disability should not be a barrier to accessing research. Thank you for your continued support in championing open access for all.

Have a free development cycle? Help support accessibility at arXiv! Our collaborators at LaTeXML maintain a list of packages that need conversion, and welcome developer contributions.
